main event: A bright, fast-moving disc-shaped craft was observed traversing due east over Baker, Florida on 7th October 1957 for a duration of 15 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as round, ballistic, and very brilliant, ruling out the possibility of it being a balloon.
Aircraft were encountered after the sighting, suggesting that the object's behavior was unusual.
The witness was a student and reported clear weather conditions with no obstructions.

The Air Force director of intelligence suggested that the object was likely a balloon due to winds and upper air currents, but the rapid eastward movement and brilliance of the object could not be explained by this theory.
No photographs were included with the report.
